Constructor Detail

Ball

public Ball(BowdoinSoccer.World parent)
Create a soccer ball and place it on the field. This is done by placing in the middle (horizontally) and within a fixed range vertically.

Parameters:
parent - The soccer field.
Method Detail

RandomPlace

public void RandomPlace()
Move the ball back to a new start. Sometimes this is done when neither team scores over a long period of time. In such a case we have to be careful not to put the ball on top of a player.

Kick

public void Kick(int direction)

GetLocation

public java.awt.Point GetLocation()
Return the x,y location of the ball.

Returns:
Point contains the location of the ball.

StopBall

public void StopBall()
Stop the momentum of the ball.

Erase

public void Erase(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                  java.awt.Rectangle ClipRect)
Erase the ball on the screen. Being a good java object the ball is responsible for drawing itself. When it moves, it draws over itself before drawing itself again in a new location.

Parameters:
gc - The graphics object we draw to.
ClipRect - The part of the window we are drawing in.

Draw

public void Draw(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                 java.awt.Rectangle ClipRect)
Draws the ball on the screen.

Parameters:
gc - The current graphics object.
ClipRect - The part of the object we are drawing to.

Translate

public void Translate(java.awt.Point Delta)
Move the ball in the required direction. This function is called in response to the ball's requesting a BallAction from World. Never call it directly - the redraw won't be handled properly.

Parameters:
Delta - the amount of change in each direction.

run

public void run()
Act like a ball. Move when required, stay still otherwise, unless we're at an impass.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

IsAt

public boolean IsAt(java.awt.Point target)
Tests whether the ball is at a certain location.

Parameters:
target - The location to be tested.
Returns:
boolean
